result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Gray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concur to 14CF1341.
8/15/17 Probation is extended for 3 yr from 11/14/17 to 11/14/20, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.
8/10/17  Probation is extended for 3 yrs from 11/14/17 to 11/14/18, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with all Summit Credit Unions, Wipp Brothers Ag Services Dane, WI, JW or ED. Not possess or consume any illegal drugs. Not possess any drug paraphernalia.

Maintain stable residence. Participate with the DOC electronic monitoring program as deemed appropriate by DOC agent. Completion of Compas needs assessment and follow through with recommendations. Random UA testing at the request of DOC agent or any treatment provider. Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; counsel offer agreement for plea hearing & request for PSI; Ct conducts colloquy with defn; defn pleads guilty to ct 1; Ct adjudicates defn guilty of ct 1; Ct DRI'd cts 2, 3 & 4; bail revoked; Ct ordered PSI; Ct will send notice of SEH; Ct adjourned.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)
Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.

DE requests witness sequestration, granted. Deputy duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Venue established. DE identified. State moves for b/o, waives argument, reserves rebuttal. DE objects to b/o. Argument by DE. Ct finds PC fel committed
Preliminary hearing on August 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jeremy W.
- Defendant shall not be at any resale shops or pawn stores.
- Defendant shall not be at Wipp Brothers Ag Service.
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 12

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney State Public Defender.  Chelsea E Wetjen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.
